intro: Coelopleurum multisectum f. trichocarpum, commonly known as the trichocarpum form, is a rare and specialized variant of the species. It is characterized by its unique morphological features, including the presence of trichocarps, which are specialized fruits with hairy structures. The plant typically exhibits a compact growth habit with finely dissected leaves, showcasing intricate leaf venation patterns. It thrives in specific microhabitats, often in shaded, moist environments with rich organic soil. Due to its limited distribution and distinctive botanical traits, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
